author: @netfla_oficial
title: Flamengo vira sobre Red Bull Bragantino com gol no fim e cola no líder Cruzeiro
text:
O
Flamengo
não desistiu e venceu o
Red Bull Bragantino
, por 2 a 1, de virada, na noite desta quarta-feira (23), no Estádio Municipal Cícero de Souza Marques, em Bragança Paulista, pela 16ª rodada do
Campeonato Brasileiro
.
Lucas Barbosa abriu o placar para o Massa Bruta logo aos 4 segundos do 2º tempo, mas Léo Pereira deixou tudo igual e Wesley garantiu a vitória rubro-negra no fim da partida.
A vitória coloca o Flamengo na cola do líder
Cruzeiro
, com
33 pontos
contra
34
dos mineiros. Por outro lado, o Red Bull Bragantino perdeu a segunda seguida e estacionou nos
27
, na
quarta colocação
.
Titular pela primeira vez desde o atrito com Filipe Luís, Pedro não conseguiu repetir a performance do Fla-Flu e teve uma atuação apagada no interior paulista.
Como foi o jogo
O início do Red Bull Bragantino surpreendeu o Flamengo. Foram duas chances antes dos cinco minutos. Henry Mosquera desarmou Varela e chutou pela linha de fundo, enquanto Lucas Barbosa recebeu cruzamento rasteiro e mandou na rede pelo lado de fora. A resposta rubro-negra veio na finalização de Bruno Henrique defendida por Cleiton.
Depois de um começo movimentado, a partida caiu de ritmo e só foi ter emoção nos minutos finais. Vinicinho assustou Rossi em chute cruzado para fora e Jhon Jhon só não marcou um golaço de falta porque o goleiro do Flamengo desviou com as pontas dos dedos.
Filipe Luís optou por não mexer no intervalo mesmo com uma atuação ruim no primeiro tempo e foi castigo logo aos oito segundos da etapa final. Na saída de bola, Jhon Jhon lançou Lucas Barbosa nas costas do improvisado Varela e o atacante só teve o trabalho de tocar na saída de Rossi.
O Flamengo se lançou para o ataque e, depois de Arrascaeta assustar em chute para fora, Léo Pereira empatou aos 20 minutos. O zagueiro aproveitou falta cobrada pelo uruguaio e, dentro da pequena área, cabeceou para o gol. O Red Bull Bragantino sentiu e levou a virada.
De tanto insistir, o Flamengo marcou aos 39 minutos. Viña fez boa jogada individual e encontrou Wallace Yan, que ajeitou para Wesley chutar cruzado no cantinho de Cleiton.
Classificação no Brasileirão:
-
Red Bull Bragantino: 4º colocado, com 27 pontos
-
Flamengo: 2º colocado, com 33 pontos
Próximos jogos do Red Bull Bragantino:
-
Fortaleza(F): 26/07, 18h30 (de Brasília) -Brasileirão -
Botafogo(F): 29/07, 19h (de Brasília) -Copa do Brasil -
Atlético-MG(F): 03/08, 18h30 (de Brasília) -Brasileirão

-
Atlético-MG(C): 27/07, 20h30 (de Brasília) -Brasileirão -
Atlético-MG(C): 31/07, 21h30 (de Brasília) -Copa do Brasil -
Ceará(F): 03/08, 18h30 (de Brasília) -Brasileirão

author: Admin
title: Ela Vashishtha’s Digital Medical Pad Promises Efficient Care Anywhere
text:
Digital Media Pad prototype
The healthcare landscape is constantly evolving, demanding innovative solutions to address challenges faced by patients and medical professionals alike. In this pursuit of progress, health resources and strategy leader Ela Vashishtha has emerged as a pioneer, spearheading the development of a groundbreaking invention: the Digital Medical Pad.
More than just a technological innovation, this patented device embodies Ms. Vashishtha’s deep understanding of healthcare complexities, honed through her vast experience managing a $3 billion portfolio and driving data-driven initiatives across 25+ hospitals in her state of residency. This expertise shines through in every facet of the Digital Medical Pad, designed to address critical issues plaguing healthcare systems, particularly in resource-constrained settings.
Secure Access, Streamlined Processes
At the heart of the invention lies a secure biometric scanner. Gone are the days of misplaced charts and stolen identities; fingerprints grant authorized personnel instant access to a patient’s medical history, ensuring both privacy and efficient care delivery. Medication management takes a leap forward with the pad’s ability to display medication history and facilitate digital order creation. This not only reduces waiting times but also minimizes errors and potential drug interactions.
Real-Time Intelligence Powering Decisions
The Digital Medical Pad transcends mere data storage. Embedded AI and machine learning algorithms work synergistically with real-time data to empower healthcare professionals. Imagine a scenario where a doctor, upon entering a patient’s fever symptom, receives treatment suggestions tailored to the patient’s unique medical profile, considering factors like co-existing conditions and potential allergies. This level of real-time decision support enhances diagnostic accuracy and optimizes treatment plans, paving the way for personalized, effective care.
Bridging the Global Healthcare Divide
Ms. Vashishtha’s vision extends beyond borders. Recognizing the immense potential of the Digital Medical Pad in resource-limited countries, she is leading the charge in adapting the technology for these specific contexts. The device’s affordability and portability make it ideal for rural areas, where access to quality healthcare has traditionally been limited. By eliminating paper records and cumbersome processes, the pad promises to revolutionize care delivery in underprivileged regions, democratizing access to crucial medical information and services.
Partnerships for Progress
The journey towards widespread adoption of the Digital Medical Pad is underway. Ms. Vashishtha is actively seeking partnerships with multiple entities in India, aiming to pilot the device in rural areas and smaller cities. These collaborations will serve as testaments to the pad’s effectiveness and pave the way for its broader implementation across developing nations. Currently, she is partnering with and providing strategic advice on product advancement ideas, market strategies, future iterations of testing the pad in Indian healthcare market.
A Beacon of Hope
Ela Vashishtha’s Digital Medical Pad opens the possibility of a future where healthcare is accessible, efficient, and personalized in developing and developed worlds alike. By harnessing the power of technology and focusing on real-world needs, Ms. Vashishtha is trying to forge a path towards a healthier, more equitable world. This innovation holds the potential to bridge healthcare divides, empower medical professionals, and improve the lives of millions, making it a truly transformative force in the global healthcare landscape.

author: Jim Altman
title: Community, Corned Beef & Cabbage are a recipe for success | fox61.com
text: COLCHESTER, Conn. — The corned beef and cabbage is already being cooked at the Inishmor Pub in [Colchester](https://www.fox61.com/section/new-london-county). Now nearly a decade old, the Irish pub is looking forward to a Saint Patrick’s Day that falls on a Sunday in 2024 - and that will only help business. Owner and head chef Alex Levere said, “it’s super Sunday,” and added, “that’s the one day everyone wants to be in an Irish Pub – from 8 a.m. to probably 9 p.m. it’s full.” Levere, who trained as a chef in Ireland, said that corned beef and cabbage is king all week in Colchester, “this week (we will prepare) somewhere between 1,500 and 16,000 pounds, and for the month just over a ton.” Andrew Kyser, the bar manager at the Inishmor, said that Saint Patrick’s Day at the pub is, “the best chaos because it’s everyone you know – it’s friends and family that come in.” Having navigated the pitfalls of the pandemic, Levere said that this year feels different. “I would say last year was about recovery and coming out of COVID, it still didn’t feel as authentic as it should – this year is about celebrating. It’s about making memories and it’s about relationships," he said. After preparing a signature Shepards Pie, which is a crowd favorite, Levere added that Saint Patrick’s Day at the Inishmor “is the culmination of a year's worth of work.” To learn more about the Inishmor Pub in Colchester click [https://theinishmorpub.com/](https://theinishmorpub.com/). Do you have a story idea or something on your mind you want to share? We want to hear from you! Email us at [newstips@fox61.com](mailto:newstips@fox61.com). Jimmy Altman is a reporter at FOX61 News. He can be reached at jaltman@fox61.com. Follow him on [ X](https://twitter.com/JimmyAltman) and ---- MORE FOX61 TAG: Add to every story after the YouTube embed at the bottom. author: Brian.Oruta@radioafricagroup.co.ke (BRIAN ORUTA)
title: Unite DRC! Uhuru tells Tshisekedi after re-election
text:
• Uhuru who is the African Union-Kenya Peace Envoy and Facilitator of the East African Community-led Nairobi Peace Process said peace is the foundation of any prosperous nation.
• As of Saturday, Tshisekedi had garnered around 72% of the votes during elections held on December 20, 2023. At least 17.8 million votes have been counted.
Former President Uhuru Kenyatta has urged re-elected Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) President Felix Tshisekedi to embrace peace and unite his country.
In his congratulatory message, Uhuru who is the African Union-Kenya Peace Envoy and Facilitator of the East African Community-led Nairobi Peace Process said peace is the foundation of any prosperous nation.
“Peace and unity are the foundations of a prosperous country,” he said.
As of Saturday, Tshisekedi had garnered around 72 per cent of the votes during elections held on December 20, 2023. At least 17.8 million votes have been counted.
He now awaits confirmation by the country's electoral commission.
Tshisekedi, 60, has been in power since January 2019 and is running for a second five-year term.
Moise Katumbi, a former governor of Katanga province, is second with 18.9 per cent.
President Tshisekedi faced 18 candidates as he sought a second term.
Some 44 million people were eligible to cast their ballots, following a campaign dominated by worsening conflict in the mineral-rich east.
On Thursday, Police in the Democratic Republic of Congo clashed with opposition supporters demanding that the presidential poll be annulled.
Leading opposition candidates denounced the election as a sham and demanded a rerun.
The opposition has also accused the electoral commission of orchestrating fraud and ballot stuffing in order to pave the way for Mr Tshisekedi to be declared the winner.
The commission has denied the allegations.
Voters also chose parliamentary, provincial and municipal representatives, with about 100,000 candidates in total.
The elections were not held in parts of the east because of insecurity.

author: @kazinformkz
title: Ушел из жизни казахстанский актер Кайрат Кемалов
text:
Ушел из жизни казахстанский актер Кайрат Кемалов
На 69-м году жизни не стало заслуженного деятеля Казахстана, выдающегося актера Кайрата Кемалова, передает агентство Kazinform.
Об этом на своей странице в Instagram сообщил аким Карагандинской области Ермаганбет Булекпаев.
— Он всю свою жизнь посвятил сцене и казахстанскому искусству. Карьера Кайрата Кемалова начиналась в Караганде, но достижения и признание вышли далеко за пределы области. Он создавал сильные образы, за которые получал высокие награды и международную известность. За свою жизнь Кайрат Кемалов подарил зрителям сотни ролей: от классических до современных. Его мастерство, преданность профессии и любовь к людям оставили глубокий след в истории отечественного театра и кино. Память о Кайрате Кемалове останется в сердцах коллег, учеников, друзей и всех, кто любил его творчество. Светлая память! — написал глава региона.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 中国A50ETF（563000）跌0.85%，半日成交额696.68万元_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，中国A50ETF（563000）跌0.85%，报0.819元，成交额696.68万元。中国A50ETF（563000）重仓股方面， 宁德时代 截止午盘跌1.13%， 贵州茅台 涨0.00%， 紫金矿业 跌1.44%， 比亚迪 跌1.40%， 招商银行 跌0.70%， 海光信息 跌0.68%， 万华化学 跌1.07%， 长江电力 跌0.33%， 立讯精密 跌0.58%， 恒瑞医药 跌0.66%。
中国A50ETF（563000）业绩比较基准为MSCI中国A50互联互通人民币指数(MSCI China A 50 Connect RMB Index)收益率，管理人为易方达基金管理有限公司，基金经理为宋钊贤、林伟斌，成立（2021-10-29）以来回报为-17.36%，近一个月回报为-1.10%。

author: Renewable Fuels Association
title: RFA Applauds Lawmakers for Demanding the Use of Sound Science in SAF Carbon Modeling
text: The Renewable Fuels Association today thanked a bipartisan group of 43 lawmakers in both houses of Congress who [sent a letter](https://d35t1syewk4d42.cloudfront.net/file/2658) to the Biden administration’s Sustainable Aviation Fuels Lifecycle Analysis Interagency Working Group, asking them to meet their March 1 deadline for updates to the GREET model and ensure the updates are based on sound science, current data, and methodologies that properly recognize modern practices in agriculture and biofuel production. “RFA applauds this bipartisan group of lawmakers led by Sens. Klobuchar, Thune and Duckworth, and Reps. Craig, Pocan, Johnson and Smith for pushing the Biden administration to ensure the proper implementation of sustainable aviation fuel tax credits,” said RFA President and CEO Geoff Cooper. "We thank these lawmakers for urging the administration to utilize the best available science and data when determining eligibility for the SAF tax credit established in the Inflation Reduction Act. A transparent and scientifically sound approach is crucial to stimulating investment in domestic SAF production, fostering innovation and creating American jobs." The bicameral letter was led by Sens. Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), John Thune (R-SD) and Tammy Duckworth (D-IL), and Reps. Angie Craig (D-MN), Mark Pocan (D-WI), Dusty Johnson (R-SD) and Adrian Smith R-NE). “Biofuels drive economic growth, create good-paying manufacturing jobs and strengthen economies across rural America,” the lawmakers write. “As you continue to develop a model to determine eligibility, we ask that you take measures to permit every participant in the SAF lifecycle to appropriately participate in the carbon reduction process.”

organizations.name: saf carbon modeling the renewable fuels association
sustainable aviation fuels lifecycle analysis interagency working group
